OM_Gale_AOM_OOM.synopsis: AOM or OOM that triggers when talking to Elminster.Elminster does a brief introduction before joining the camp, potentially taking the players along.Can trigger in either Creche or SCL.
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM.how_to_trigger: - Give Gale at least one magic item, go to SCL_Main_A, and, without the Avatar, approach Elminster at S_ORI_Gale_ElminsterPoint_SCL_975ef355-b68e-4061-bda8-b774e8ff552fOR- Give Gale at least one magic item, without the Avatar, go to CRE_Main_A, and approach Elminster at S_ORI_Gale_ElminsterPoint_CRE_f5a225ef-d123-449f-98e2-53309a21979b

OM_Gale_COM.synopsis: Elminster standing on a balcony attached to Sharess caress in Wyrm's crossing, looking outward. He's here to decry Gale on Mystra's behalf - Gale had a chance to sacrifice himself and destroy the Absolute previously, but hesitated. Now Elminster is here to relay the consequencs to him.
OM_Gale_COM.how_to_trigger: With Gale as a party member, go to CTY_Main_A. Without Gale, go to S_LOW_ElminsterPoint_667ae972-3934-44f1-8a47-ddb667de4cf7 and talk to Elminster.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_5.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_5.text: The truth, Elminster. How Karsus' Crown could yet be reforged. Or destroyed, as the case may be.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_53.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_53.text: If it was up to her, I'd be a pile of ash along with the rest of the shadow-cursed lands by now. I can't imagine what she has to say to me. 'Sorry', perhaps.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_61.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_61.text: Gale of Waterdeep, as I live and breathe. As do you, I'm glad to see.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_11.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_11.text: I hear you've been browsing in most esteemed of emporiums, Sorcerous Sundries. Indulge my curiosity - what wonders did you discover there?
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_11.context: NodeContext: He knows exactly what you were doing there - discovering the secret of the Crown of Karsus

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_56.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_56.text: Tell me, what curiosities did you discover within the walls of this esteemed emporium?
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_56.context: NodeContext: He knows exactly what you were doing there - discovering the secret of the Crown of Karsus

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_43.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_43.text: A way to destroy the Absolute without using the orb. I hope.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_44.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_44.text: You have learned the truth of the enemy we face. The Crown of Karsus, the very tool with which its eponymous creator unmade magic itself.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_12.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_12.text: Perhaps now you understand what is at stake here, m'boy. Though what Mystra asked of you was extreme, it was not without merit nor demanded lightly.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_42.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_42.text: She knows you defied her, Gale. Of course she knows - she's Mystra.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_23.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_23.text: You don't seem all that surprised to see me alive and well.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_32.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_32.text: I had been pondering what exactly I should say to you. This was not a conversation we were ever supposed to have, m'boy.
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Grave, almost mournful lookNodeContext: Grave

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_6.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_6.text: Selfish it may be, but I won't deny my happiness that you exercised patience in this matter. And, by now, you are surely aware of the evil we are up against. Karsus' pestilent Crown.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_9.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_9.text: Oh, nothing in particular. Some charms here, some potions there...

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_26.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_26.text: Is that so? Well, far be it for this doddering old arch mage to pry into another man's shopping bag.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_35.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_35.text: As we're here, I shall offer you a morsel of general and non-specific advice - yours to apply to any relevant knowledge you may have recently acquired.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_37.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_37.text: Some things are best left broken. And some people are well worth restoring.
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_37.context: NodeContext: Very pointed - telling Gale not to restore the crown, but to focus on improving himself

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_18.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_18.text: Mystra knows what I see in you. Just as I know what she sees in you. I was not born an old man. I know all too well what it's like to have a goddess fill your heart with longing.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_49.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_49.text: She bids you come to her holy shrine in the Stormshore Tabernacle. There, she will grant you an audience at last.
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_49.context: NodeContext: Urgent, serious - delivering the message he was bid to give to Gale

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_7.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_7.text: Very well. I'll seek her statue at the Tabernacle.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_28.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_28.text: Perhaps... perhaps that should have been your mission right from the start.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_19.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_19.text: The spark of promise burns in you once more, m'boy. And Mystra believes that spark may yet catch fire.
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_19.context: NodeContext: Restrained hope - he's come to offer Gale the chance of redemption

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_20.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_20.text: She's finally decided to get involved, has she? About bloody time.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_27.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_27.text: She was anything but idle - she chose you as her champion. A fine choice too, I thought. Yet now you threaten to prove otherwise...

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_55.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_55.text: I assure you, it will be very simple in the end - there is only success or failure.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_58.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_58.text: That sounds dangerous. I thought she wanted me dead?

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_46.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_46.text: Hardly. She wishes to wash away this bad blood between you, before it festers any further. Such grudges only lessen the chance any of us survive the strife to come.
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_46.context: NodeContext: Grave. If Gale is against Mystra, this will be incredibly dangerous

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_38.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_38.text: She does not make such a gesture lightly. The hourglass measuring our time for such alternatives has but a few grains remaining.
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_38.context: NodeContext: Grave, this reprieve is not without its dangers

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_16.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_16.text: The Crown is not the answer. I promise you that.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_34.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_34.text: If you will not hear it from me, hear it from your goddess. What truths she has to offer are for your ears alone, Gale of Waterdeep. Godspeed.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_14.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_14.text: Trust in yourself. Trust in the Weave. If you are willing, trust in Mystra. There is a conclusion yet to be written in this sorry tale, Gale of Waterdeep, and yours is the quill that will write it.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_47.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_47.text: I don't need Mystra's help. I can defeat the Absolute without her.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_21.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_21.text: That is true. Vanishingly unlikely, but true. You must forgive Mystra for despairing - she provided means and opportunity to end this, but that chance went unseized.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_29.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_29.text: If there is another way, I trust you can find it. It is not in your nature or mine to stop looking, to accept the first answer to any dilemma. Do what you can - put that mind to work.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_25.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_25.text: Whatever Mystra has to say to me, it's far too late. I'm getting that Crown.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_40.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_40.text: There is only one reason why you should set your ambitions on such an item - to offer it over to Mystra as a token of your loyalty. Perhaps then she would overlook your earlier failings.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_8.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_8.text: But if you crave it for yourself...? You would not just be failing her, you would be challenging her. Choose wisely, Gale. Do not trade one calamity for another.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_50.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_50.text: I learned how to reforge the Crown of Karsus. And I'm going to do it.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_33.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_33.text: The Crown of Karsus? You know what catastrophe that thing brought about for Netheril, don't you?
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_33.context: NodeContext: Alarmed. Believes Gale is playing with fire

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_48.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_48.text: No one asks for an encore of Karsus' Folly - in fact, it might even be better to allow the Absolute to run rampant than to risk such a thing.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_1.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_1.text: I was destined for greatness, Elminster. This might be my only chance to take it.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_36.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_36.text: Caution need not deny you the possibility of greatness, so long as you are willing to consider what your definition of greatness may be. It is too often applied where other, far less savoury terms would be appropriate.
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_36.context: NodeContext: Advising, a hint of warning - don't get carried away with this

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_54.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_54.text: Mystra knows you defied her, Gale. Of course she knows - she's Mystra.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_22.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_22.text: If I can exploit the Crown's powers, I could defeat the Absolute in an instant. We'd never fear their like again.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_24.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_24.text: Exploit? To what end, m'boy...? It would be deeply unwise to repeat an old mistake, and anger Mystra yet further.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_0.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_0.text: You have a better suggestion? I'm all ears.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_10.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_10.text: If there is some path yet undiscovered, some means of prising success from the maw of perdition... I believe I'm standing before the very wizard for the task.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_24.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_24.text: Ho there, wanderer. Stay thy course a moment to indulge an old man.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_5.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_5.text: The very same, Gale. And a fair bit miffed he is, too, finding himself forced to expose his best pair of boots to so many miles of country road on your behalf.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_15.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_15.text: My sympathies for your wearied soles. Care to explain what you're doing?

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_20.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_20.text: I was bid to spare neither time nor my own self to find you. She sent me, Gale. You know of whom I speak.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_8.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_8.text: Mystra? What does she want of me?

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_9.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_9.text: Mystra, aye, m'boy. But what she wants is a matter better discussed in more comfortable environs. Knowing you, I'll wager your camp is a veritable home away from home.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_17.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_17.text: Lead the way - then I can rest these bones of mine for a spell, and you can learn all I have to share.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_28.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_28.text: Head to my camp yourself. I'll join when I can.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_11.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_11.text: Perhaps I didn't convey the gravity of the situation, if you think you have better things to be doing. But very well, I shall see you there.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_33.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_33.text: Don't keep me in suspense, Elminster.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_26.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_26.text: Mystra, of course. But what she wants is a matter better discussed in more comfortable environs. Knowing you, I'll wager your camp is a veritable home away from home.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_6.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_6.text: Well, boots are made for walking. I believe a bard once said something similar.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_31.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_31.text: Is that so? It must have escaped my ears. But no matter - this is far more important than some worn leather.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_30.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_30.text: Spare me the chagrin - I didn't ask for you to track me down.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_12.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_12.text: Nor did I ask to play bloodhound, yet here we are.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_10.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_10.text: What, nothing at all to say? It's me, Gale - Elminster. And quite some lengths I've taken - figurative and literal - to clap eyes on you.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_25.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_25.text: Why, I've reduced my best boots to mere shadows of their former glory in pursuit of you.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_22.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_22.text: I'm not feeling all that indulgent just now.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_13.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_13.text: Come now, Gale. It's me - Elminster. And quite some lengths I've taken - figurative and literal - to clap eyes on you.

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_34.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_34.text: My sympathies for your wearied soles. Care to explain what you're doing?

OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_1.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_AOM_OOM_1.text: Mystra? What does she want of me?

OM_Gale_COM_34.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_34.text: May I inquire if perchance you retain among your travelling companions a man who adheres to the given name of Gale?

OM_Gale_COM_9.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_9.text: As a matter of fact, I do. He's resting in camp.

OM_Gale_COM_4.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_4.text: Ever a man of leisure. Would it pain you greatly to assist me along the little voyage I intend to undertake to this aforementioned camp?

OM_Gale_COM_3.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_3.text: And I would confirm it to be so. Please, after you.

OM_Gale_COM_64.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_64.text: I'd like to know first who I'd be bringing to see Gale.

OM_Gale_COM_5.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_5.text: Now, if this answer satisfies you, let us linger no longer in this limbo of indecision, but set course for your camp forthwith.

OM_Gale_COM_7.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_7.text: Elminster Aumar! Yes of course, it would be my honour.

OM_Gale_COM_21.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_21.text: Very well. Let's go see Gale then.

OM_Gale_COM_69.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_69.text: A splendid notion! Please, after you.

OM_Gale_COM_76.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_76.text: I'm sure you'll have no trouble finding our camp without my assistance. I'll see you there later.

OM_Gale_COM_14.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_14.text: I'm sure you'll have no trouble finding our camp without my assistance. I'll see you there later.

OM_Gale_COM_51.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_51.text: Though I'd have welcomed a voice other than my own to entertain me along my weary way, I shall take your answer in stride and with it, take my leave as well.

OM_Gale_COM_52.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_52.text: May I inquire who is inquiring?

OM_Gale_COM_13.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_13.text: Should it be the nature of our acquaintance that interests you, you may safely classify Gale and I as friends.

OM_Gale_COM_79.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_79.text: Should it be the nature of your present interlocutor that you desire to drag from the darkened unknown, I shall be glad to aid in your quest for illumination and identify myself as Elminster. Elminster Aumar.

OM_Gale_COM_8.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_8.text: Now, if this answer satisfies you, let us linger no longer in this limbo of indecision, but settle on your knowledge of the individual I seek.

OM_Gale_COM_62.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_62.text: It's a great honour to meet you, Elminster! I do know Gale, yes. He's in our camp at the moment.

OM_Gale_COM_74.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_74.text: I do know Gale, yes. He's in our camp at the moment.

OM_Gale_COM_38.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_38.text: I'm afraid I must settle it in the negative: I do not know Gale.

OM_Gale_COM_60.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_60.text: Gale, you say? Never heard of him.

OM_Gale_COM_72.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_72.text: Even though I suspect your denial soils rather than sustains the splendid dominion that is the truth, I shall take your answer in stride and with it, take my leave as well.

OM_Gale_COM_45.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_45.context:
InternalNodeContext: User and dialog flag - Elminster only remembers the denied al according the the Dialog flag.
The user flag is here to avoid him addressing other members of the same party.

OM_Gale_COM_33.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_33.text: Ho there, wanderer. Stay thy course a moment to indulge an old man.

OM_Gale_COM_17.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_17.text: The very same, Gale. And a fair bit miffed he is, too, finding himself forced to expose his best pair of boots to so many miles of country road on your behalf.

OM_Gale_COM_11.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_11.text: Elminster Aumar, the very pinnacle of wizardry. It's an honour, sir.

OM_Gale_COM_12.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_12.text: Endure an hour's worth of exposition to my presence, and you may well come to consider a different sort of honorific with which to chronicle the occasion, but until then, your sentiment is well-received.

OM_Gale_COM_29.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_COM_29.text: Yes, yes, yes, be that as it may, you said you came all this way on my behalf, did you not? For what purpose?

OM_Gale_COM_61.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_61.text: I was bid to spare neither time nor my own self to find you. She sent me, Gale. You know of whom I speak.

OM_Gale_COM_24.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_COM_24.text: But why? Out with it, Elminster. Please!

OM_Gale_COM_78.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_78.text: Young man, has your sojourn away from Waterdeep washed away your decorum as well as your patience?

OM_Gale_COM_75.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_75.text: Nigh a tenday I've gone without honest fare worthy of the name - drank naught but what the sky entitled my thirst.

OM_Gale_COM_1.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_1.text: Why, some bread, cheese, and a cup of wine would appear unto me a feast! Surely you won't begrudge me a mite of rest and repast before I get 'out with it'?

OM_Gale_COM_67.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_67.text: Yes, Gale. Where is your decorum?

OM_Gale_COM_71.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_71.text: This way, then, hmmm, to your camp? Don't dawdle now, lad. You're the one who's in such a frightful hurry.

OM_Gale_COM_16.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_COM_16.text: Nigh on thirteen centuries old and he still thinks with his stomach. We'd best follow, and see if he's more disposed to speak plainly once it's stopped its grumbling.
OM_Gale_COM_16.context: NodeContext: Aside to player, low enough that it wouldn't be heard by the departing Elminster

OM_Gale_COM_23.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_23.text: Very well. I suppose I'm as curious as you are to hear what he has to say.

OM_Gale_COM_44.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_COM_44.text: A wise choice. Better to indulge our curiosity than Elminster's appetite.

OM_Gale_COM_65.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_65.text: We'll meet him in camp later. Let him have his rest and repast in the meantime.

OM_Gale_COM_57.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_57.text: Surely you could have conjured any feast you liked.

OM_Gale_COM_20.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_20.text: Alas, such luxuries require the beneficence of time, and time, as I'm sure our friend here will attest, is the very luxury of which we're all too bereft.

OM_Gale_COM_47.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_47.text: I suppose we could part with a few of our rations.

OM_Gale_COM_68.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_68.text: And a great kindness that would be! See, Gale? Even in these barren parts, the art of hospitality begets inspired new works if one only keeps up the practice.

OM_Gale_COM_2.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_2.text: I'm not in the habit of taking in vagabonds.

OM_Gale_COM_40.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_40.text: Oh? And what is he, then, wandering these forlorn barrens over seven hundred miles from home?
OM_Gale_COM_40.context: CinematicNodeContext: On ‘he’, he points to Gale.NodeContext: On ‘he’, he points to Gale.

OM_Gale_COM_25.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_25.text: Elminster Aumar, favoured like none other by exalted Mystra. It's an honour, sir.

OM_Gale_COM_36.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_36.text: My, not every day one meets the hero of countless ballads in the flesh.

OM_Gale_COM_15.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_15.text: I know a minstrel by trade when I see one! Tell me, what ballad bold enough to lift me unto the pedestal of acclaim enjoys your musical predilection?

OM_Gale_COM_58.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_58.text: The Day the Dragon Woke in Flame, Elminster Hailed the Wyrm King's Heir.

OM_Gale_COM_80.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_80.text: Ha! Old, but hearty, and rife with witty flourishes - not unlike myself. I confess it to be among my favoured few as well.

OM_Gale_COM_30.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_30.text: Ten Leagues Into the Underdark, the Wizard Bore the Lance of Krynn.

OM_Gale_COM_66.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_66.text: Ah, yes, and a fine melody it is too. Its verses fail to mention however, the sheer weight of that monstrous lance.

OM_Gale_COM_22.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_22.text: Why, but one league down, and such was the extent of my perspirations that my hat could have doubled as an aquarium.

OM_Gale_COM_46.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_46.text: Across the Peaks of Icewind Dale, Strode Fast the Sage of Shadowdale.

OM_Gale_COM_54.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_54.text: Is that so? The lyrics are by Volo, you know, whose name alone is sufficient enough a criterion to arbitrate its acclaim to truth.

OM_Gale_COM_35.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_35.text: Two weeks I had to endure a frozen beard and wicked frostbites, yet he makes it sound like a dalliance through the Dales.

OM_Gale_COM_31.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_31.text: I think some proper introductions are in order.

OM_Gale_COM_48.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_COM_48.text: Meet Elminster Aumar. A good friend of mine, but rather more significantly, he's the most famed and respected wizard in the realms.

OM_Gale_COM_37.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_37.text: Am I, indeed? Most famed and respected errand boy, more like.

OM_Gale_COM_41.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_41.text: Many miles, you say. Where do you hail from?

OM_Gale_COM_59.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_COM_59.text: Originally? Shadowdale. Lately? The fanciest inns of Waterdeep.

OM_Gale_COM_6.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_6.text: Hit that country road, old man. I'm not interested in the junk you sell or the junk you tell.

OM_Gale_COM_55.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_COM_55.context: NodeContext: He doesn’t say this in anger, but in utter shock and surprise that the player would venture to insult the famed Elminster.

OM_Gale_COM_77.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_COM_77.text: This is Elminster Aumar, the most famed and respected wizard in the realms!

OM_Gale_COM_44.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_COM_44.context: NodeContext: Not entirely surprised to see him

OM_Gale_COM_26.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_26.text: Hello m'boy. Don't mind me - I'm just enjoying a fresh lungful of Baldurian air - a distinctive aroma, though perhaps not one worthy of bottling.

OM_Gale_COM_42.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_42.text: I hear you've been browsing in most esteemed of emporiums, Sorcerous Sundries. Indulge my curiosity - what wonders did you discover there?
OM_Gale_COM_42.context: NodeContext: He knows exactly what you were doing there - discovering the secret of the Crown of Karsus

OM_Gale_COM_25.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_25.text: Tell me, what curiosities have you and your companions discovered within the walls of this esteemed emporium?
OM_Gale_COM_25.context: NodeContext: He knows exactly what you were doing there - discovering the secret of the Crown of Karsus

OM_Gale_COM_11.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_11.text: We found the Annals of Karsus. It proved an enlightening read.

OM_Gale_COM_16.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_16.text: So, you have learned the truth of the enemy we face - the very tool with which its eponymous creator unmade magic itself.

OM_Gale_COM_24.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_24.text: Perhaps now you understand what is at stake here, m'boy. Though what Mystra asked of you was extreme, it was not without merit nor demanded lightly.

OM_Gale_COM_20.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_20.text: You don't seem all that surprised to see Gale alive and well.

OM_Gale_COM_37.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_37.text: I trusted he would be sensible enough to exercise caution in this matter, and to seek the truth. By now, you are aware of the evil we are up against.

OM_Gale_COM_58.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_58.text: Karsus' pestilent Crown. The very tool with which its eponymous creator unmade an empire, and magic itself.

OM_Gale_COM_56.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_56.text: Oh, nothing in particular. Some charms here, some potions there...

OM_Gale_COM_36.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_36.text: Is that so? Well, far be it for this doddering old arch mage to pry into another man's shopping bag.

OM_Gale_COM_34.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_34.text: As we're here, I shall offer you a morsel of general and non-specific advice - yours to apply to any relevant knowledge you may have recently acquired.

OM_Gale_COM_2.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_2.text: Some things are best left broken. And some people are well worth restoring.
OM_Gale_COM_2.context: NodeContext: Very pointed - telling Gale not to restore the crown, but to focus on improving himself

OM_Gale_COM_12.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_COM_12.text: What are you saying? Or rather, what are you not saying?

OM_Gale_COM_0.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_0.text: We know how Karsus made his crown. And Gale's going to re-forge it.

OM_Gale_COM_1.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_COM_1.text: Perhaps it would have been better to keep that particular opportunity between ourselves...
OM_Gale_COM_1.context: NodeContext: Mildly chiding the player for oversharing their plans with Elminster.

OM_Gale_COM_4.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_4.text: The Crown of Karsus...? No, Gale - it's for the best that I know. I trust there's no need to remind you what came of Karsus? His folly humbled a whole civilisation; no one seeks an encore of that.
OM_Gale_COM_4.context: NodeContext: Alarmed. Believes Gale is playing with fire.

OM_Gale_COM_18.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_18.text: If we're going to defeat an enemy like the Absolute, we have to take risks.

OM_Gale_COM_8.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_8.text: Caution need not deny you the possibility of greatness, so long as you are willing to consider what your definition of greatness may be. It is too often applied where other, far less savoury terms would be appropriate.
OM_Gale_COM_8.context: NodeContext: Advising, a hint of warning - don't get carried away with this

OM_Gale_COM_28.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_28.text: Gale's the best wizard in the realms. He'll succeed where Karsus failed.

OM_Gale_COM_33.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_33.text: Do they speak true, Gale? You truly believe yourself capable of wielding Karsus' Crown?

OM_Gale_COM_32.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_COM_32.text: Perhaps they do. Would you begrudge me the chance to make things right, Elminster?

OM_Gale_COM_6.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_6.text: Of course not. And the time has come for precisely that.

OM_Gale_COM_5.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_5.text: Mystra knows you defied her, Gale. Of course she knows - she's Mystra.

OM_Gale_COM_29.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_29.text: She bids you come to her holy shrine in the Stormshore Tabernacle. There, she will grant you an audience at last.
OM_Gale_COM_29.context: NodeContext: Urgent, serious - delivering the message he was bid to give to Gale

OM_Gale_COM_3.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_3.text: You should meet her, Gale. She might be able to help us.

OM_Gale_COM_9.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_COM_9.text: I'm curious enough to make the attempt. All right - an audience with the mother of magic it is.

OM_Gale_COM_10.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_10.text: Perhaps... perhaps that should have been your mission right from the start.

OM_Gale_COM_49.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_49.text: You really think Mystra will be willing to hear Gale out?

OM_Gale_COM_30.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_30.text: I see remaining optimistic as my duty - especially when I am not the one being asked to do the seemingly impossible.

OM_Gale_COM_13.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_13.text: Mystra's done Gale enough harm. We don't owe her anything.

OM_Gale_COM_51.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_51.text: Not true. Not even close. Mystra's ways may seem cold, high-handed, tyrannical even. But she is a goddess - her ways are not for mortal reckoning...

OM_Gale_COM_23.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_23.text: ...though some mortals come close to understanding. Very close indeed.

OM_Gale_COM_46.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_46.text: Sounds good to me. Gale can tell her exactly what's coming when we get our hands on the Crown.

OM_Gale_COM_57.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_57.text: There is only one reason why you should set your ambitions on such an item - to offer it over to Mystra as a token of your loyalty. Perhaps then she would overlook your earlier failings.

OM_Gale_COM_39.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_39.text: But if you crave it for yourself...? You would not just be failing her, you would be challenging her. Choose wisely, Gale. Do not trade one calamity for another.

OM_Gale_COM_52.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_COM_52.text: Mystra's willing to speak to me again? Was this your doing, Elminster?

OM_Gale_COM_22.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_22.text: She knows what I see in you. Just as I know what she sees in you. I was not born an old man. I know all too well what it's like to have a goddess fill your heart with longing.

OM_Gale_COM_55.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_55.text: Looking at you is like gazing into a mirror that shows centuries long past.

OM_Gale_COM_47.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_COM_47.text: The past is the past, Elminster. And the future is... well, still to be decided. By me, not by Mystra.

OM_Gale_COM_48.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_48.text: If there is another way, I trust you can find it. It is not in your nature or mine to stop looking, to accept the first answer to any dilemma. Do what you can - put that mind to work.

OM_Gale_COM_35.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_35.text: The Crown is not the answer. I promise you that.

OM_Gale_COM_15.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_15.text: If you will not hear it from me, hear it from your goddess. What truths she has to offer are for your ears alone, Gale of Waterdeep. Godspeed.

OM_Gale_COM_27.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_27.text: Trust in yourself. Trust in the Weave. If you are willing, trust in Mystra. There is a conclusion yet to be written in this sorry tale, Gale of Waterdeep, and yours is the quill that will write it.

OM_Gale_COM_38.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_38.text: The Absolute already poses the same threat. Better we control the Crown than them.

OM_Gale_COM_19.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_19.text: This is not the way. However tempting it is to imagine such power would benefit this plane, it is a curse, and it always has been.

OM_Gale_COM_7.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_7.text: But perhaps the folly need not be repeated. Such a crown could be a fine token of your loyalty to Mystra, rather than a weapon to threaten her with.

OM_Gale_COM_53.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_COM_53.text: And why exactly  should Mystra have any say on what I do with Crown?

OM_Gale_COM_21.speaker: Player
OM_Gale_COM_21.text: If you've a better suggestion, we're all ears.

OM_Gale_COM_54.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_54.text: If there is yet some path undiscovered, some means of prising success from the maw of perdition... I believe Gale here may yet sniff it out, if afforded the chance.

OM_Gale_COM_45.speaker: Gale
OM_Gale_COM_45.text: Mystra hasn't seemed inclined to hand out second chances so far. None she'd have me survive, anyway.

OM_Gale_COM_50.speaker: Weary Traveller
OM_Gale_COM_50.text: She has her reasons, m'boy. And it is time you understood them.
